comments: a(n) mod 120 = 7 or 31 for all n.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2400
mathematica: Intersection[Table[n^2+6,{n,0,10^2}],Prime[Range[9*10^3]]] ...or... For[i=6,i<=6,a={};Do[If[PrimeQ[n^2+i],AppendTo[a,n^2+i]],{n,0,100}];Print["n^2+",i,",",a];i++ ] - _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Apr 29 2008Select[Table[n^2+6,{n,0,7000}],PrimeQ] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 30 2011 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [a: n in [0..700] | IsPrime(a) where a is n^2+6]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 30 2011
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 07 2000
